Mental Health on the Brink

The Megatrends Crushing Youth Mental Health — and What We Can Do About It to Save a Generation.

Kenji

As a parent, I often ask myself: How do I prepare my children for a world that seems to be shifting faster every day? With so much uncertainty, it’s clear that Generation Z and Generation Alpha will face many challenges. But one thing is undeniable — these challenges are wreaking havoc on their mental health.

The data is alarming. According to JAMA Pediatrics, depression and anxiety among young people have doubled since the pandemic [1]. In the UK alone, over 8 million people grapple with anxiety, and young adults are bearing the brunt [2].

“This Isn’t Just Stress — It’s Survival”

For years, we’ve treated youth mental health like a personal issue — a puzzle to be solved by the individual. But what if the problem isn’t just inside their heads? What if the world around them is setting them up to fail?

A report in The Lancet Psychiatry points to several “harmful megatrends” driving this crisis:

These aren’t abstract concepts—they’re daily battles. A recent New York Times article reinforces this by showing how today’s young adults (Generation Z) report higher levels of distress than any previous generation [3].

“If We Don’t Act Now, Who Will?”

The situation is dire, but despair isn’t an option. We need clear, actionable steps — before it’s too late:

“Our Society’s Health Hinges on This”

This crisis isn’t just about today’s youth (Generation Z)—it’s a mirror reflecting the cracks in our entire system. As Generation Alpha grows up, they will inherit these challenges. By fixing these issues now, we’re not just helping young people—we’re ensuring a stronger, healthier society for everyone.

As a parent, I know this fight is personal, but it’s also collective. So here’s my challenge: What will you do in your role—as a parent, educator, employer, or community member—to shift the conversation and take action?

Because if we don’t, who will?
